communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of investigation or inquiry into Frederick T Melges, American psychiatrist and professor of psychiatry at Stanford University of Medicine, who died in 1988. Following his death privacy concerns under FOIA Exemptions 6 and 7 are voided, as are any concerns under the Privacy Act. 

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frederick_T._Melges
https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/81731000/frederick-towne-melges

If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

I request that I be properly classified as a news media requester. I am a journalist and producer for a podcast production company and I am requesting this information in that editorial capacity.

Blanchard House is recognized for producing narrative podcast documentary series, reporting and publishing regular series on issues of public interest and importance, such as the below examples:

Black And Blue: blanchard-house.com/releases/blackandblue
Pirate of Prague:  https://www.blanchard-house.com/releases/nwfei4clq9mes1v8n3hacvrt3tkpi0

In addition, I have covered areas related to this request during my career, and plan to use my editorial skills (honed as a producer for the BBC for nearly 20 years) to analyze and produce original reporting work for our podcast audience who listen to our work on platforms such as Wondery, Apple podcasts or Audible. 

Examples of some of my previous journalistic work are here:
BBC Radio 4: Putin’s Religious War - https://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/m00162mp
BBC Radio 4: The Unabomber - https://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b07654x0

If you have any questions about my media status, please contact me.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rebecca Maxted

title: Chief FOIA officer's recent email (National Park Service)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Chief FOIA officer's recent email (National Park Service)
communications.communication:
Dear National Park Service,

On behalf of myself and Fiat Fiendum, I hereby request the following records:

1. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's email inbox or equivalent which was received nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
2. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's email spam folder or equivalent which was received nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
3. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's sent email folder or equivalent which was sent nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
4. The total full-time equivalent count of people who work for your FOIA office as of October 19, 2024.

This request is expressly limited to National Park Service's own FOIA office. Please do not refer it to any other agency or division. This request is expressly not a Privacy Act request, and no PA waiver will be provided.

Please provide the email records in EML, Maildir, MBOX, MIX, MSG, or PST format only — not PDF, Word, image, etc — including all metadata (e.g. full email headers as received/sent) and attachments, without alteration other than narrowly tailored electronic redaction of specifically claimed exemptions that do not affect any part of non exempt information (and, in particular, without rasterization).

Please provide the fourth record as a statement in your response letter, or at your option, as the most readily available record, in original electronic format as currently stored on your computer systems, which includes that information.

Please provide all records either as individual files, or as an unencrypted ZIP file, uploaded to MuckRock. Do not apply any encryption, DRM, or other restriction.

I request fee waiver, because
* Fiat Fiendum is a 501(c)(3) non-profit;
* this request is for public interest, non-commercial purposes;
* these records would give a snapshot of insight into the everyday processes of FOIA offices; and
* these records are being requested in order to conduct a government-wide audit of agencies' FOIA compliance.

In the event that you deny fee waiver, please process this request as-is, because I will not agree to any fees.

Please be sure to provide:
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(II) FOIA Public Liaison information
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(III)(aa) appeal information
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(III)(bb) OGIS information
* 5 USC 552(a)(7)(A) tracking number
* 5 USC 552(a)(7)(B)(ii) completion ETA

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,
Sai
President, Fiat Fiendum, Inc.

P.S. Sai is my full legal name.

communications.subject: Here's your recovery link

Dear P.S.  Sai, 

Please find your password recovery link below: 
Password Recovery Link: https://foiaxpresspal.doi.gov/App/SetPassword.aspx?aun=5d2142R8OdpaM2LEplMgco5cmycSY9hbl0cBAmSw+iw= 

Click the link above to return to DOI FOIA Office PAL and create a new password. 

If you have any questions or need further assistance, please contact the bureau at https://www.doi.gov/foia/contacts.. 

Thank you.
Regards, 
DOI FOIA Office

communications.communication:

A temporary password has been issued and sent to the email address provided. Please check your email for this temporary password and return to https://foiaxpresspal.doi.gov to login. If you have any previously submitted requests to DOI FOIA Office you will be able to view them by logging into your user account 

Please check your email for the temporary password and return to https://foiaxpresspal.doi.gov to log in. 
Thank you for your attention.
Regards, 
DOI FOIA Office

We would like to inform you that the Department of the Interior has received your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request and assigned it the control number DOI-2025-000919. Please reference this number in any future communications regarding your request. 
Dear National Park Service,

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #DOI-2025-000919
communications.communication:
Thank you for your email.

My name is just Sai. "P.S." means "post scriptum". Please update your records accordingly.

Sincerely,
Sai

communications.subject: 25-028 FOIA Acknowledgement & Clarification
communications.communication:
Sia,
Good afternoon!
We received your FOIA request and attached is our acknowledgment letter which includes your FOIA case number, 25-028. I am the Government Information Specialist assigned to your FOIA case. Please refer to your FOIA case number when checking on the status of your request.
Also, to continue processing your request we would need clarification on the records you are searching for. Your request says, "chief FOIA officer's email inbox or equivalent." Are you seeking emails from the Chief FOIA Officer's mailbox, Mr. Carl Mitchell? Or from the IHS FOIA Office group mailbox? Note: the group mailbox is the email account that receives FOIA requests and is the one to which your request was received.
Please respond back within 20 business days, or we will presume that you are no longer interested in this request and close your request.

Thank you for your interest in the Indian Health Service.
Respectfully,

David Meservey
Government Information Specialist/FOIA
Indian Health Service
5600 Fishers Lane
Rockville, MD 20857
IHSFOIAMailbox@ihs.gov<mailto:IHSFOIAMailbox@ihs.gov>

[cid:image001.png@01DB247B.2B70C630]

files.title: image001
files.source: Indian Health Service, United States of America

files.title: 25-028 Ack Letter
files.source: Indian Health Service, United States of America

files.title: attachment-3
files.source: Indian Health Service, United States of America

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #25-028
communications.communication:
Dear IHS,

Thank you for your email.

My name is Sai, not Sia.

> Are you seeking emails from the Chief FOIA Officer's mailbox, Mr. Carl Mitchell? Or from the IHS FOIA Office group mailbox?

I am seeking the former — emails from/to the Chief FOIA Officer. The clause "or equivalent" in my request modifies "inbox" / "spam folder" / "sent email folder", not "chief FOIA officer".

> Please respond back within 20 business days, or we will presume that you are no longer interested in this request and close your request.

There is no basis in law for you to "presume" that I am no longer interested in my request, or to close it for lack of response from me; case law clearly requires you to fulfill it with your best efforts.

Sincerely,
Sai

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: Chief FOIA officer's recent email (Federal Railroad Administration)
communications.communication:
Dear Sia,

The FOIA requires that requesters describe the records sought with sufficient detail to allow an agency employee familiar with the subject area of the request to locate the records with a reasonable amount of effort.

Your request does not adequately describe the records sought; therefore, we are unable to process your request at this time.

It is unclear what date(s) of the records you are requesting. Please be specific and indicate the specific date and or subject if known.  Please provide the requested information to this office no later than close of business (20 working days from date of the request).  If we do not hear from you by this time, we will presume that you are no longer interested in pursuing your request, and we will close your request in this office.

Kind regards,

Yolanda Brown
GIS/RCC 20
Office of General Law
FRA FOIA

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: Chief FOIA officer's recent email (Federal Railroad Administration)
communications.communication:
Dear FRA,

My name is Sai, not Sia.

My request was perfectly clear. I am not required to provide a specific date or subject of the emails I requested. For each of the three requests, there is exactly one email that fits its description, and it is completely unambiguous. Moreover, there is no basis in law for you to "presume" that I am no longer interested in my request, or to close it for lack of response from me; case law clearly requires you to fulfill it with your best efforts.

If you intend to refuse my request on either basis, please say so explicitly, so that I may immediately appeal your denial.

Sincerely,
Sai

communications.subject: PRC FOIA Request No. 25-28
communications.communication:
Sai, Fiat Fiendum, Inc.:

This email is in response to your request under the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), received on October 22, 2024, in which you requested:

1. The one email in the Commission’s chief FOIA officer's email inbox or equivalent which was received nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
2. The one email in the Commission’s chief FOIA officer's email spam folder or equivalent which was received nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
3. The one email in the Commission’s chief FOIA officer's sent email folder or equivalent which was sent nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
4. The total full-time equivalent count of people who work for your FOIA office as of October 19, 2024.

The Commission has conducted a search, which revealed three responsive records.  We are releasing two records in full and withholding one under FOIA exemption 5 U.S.C. § 552(b)(5) as it contains attorney-client privileged information, and the release of such information will cause foreseeable harm. We do not have any records that are responsive to number 4, and FOIA does not require an agency to create records.  In addition, we are providing the records in PDF as we do not have the ability to securely release records in any other format. We are also sending these via email as uploading documents to a site not approved is a violation of government cybersecurity policy.

Your request for a fee waiver is moot since fees were not assessed for the processing of your request.

You may appeal this response by filing an appeal within ninety (90) days, in the following ways:

By filing an appeal at the following address:

David A. Trissell, Chief FOIA Officer
Postal Regulatory Commission
901 New York Avenue, NW, Suite 200
Washington, DC 20268-0001
E-mail: foia@prc.gov<mailto:foia@prc.gov>

Additionally, the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS) was created by way of a 2007 amendment to the FOIA to provide mediation services to resolve disputes between FOIA requesters and federal agencies as a non-exclusive alternative to litigation.  Using the OGIS for mediation does not affect your right to pursue litigation. You may contact OGIS in any of the following ways:

Office of Government Information Services
National Archives and Records Administration
8601 Adelphi Road
College Park, MD 20740-6001
Email: ogis@nara.gov<mailto:ogis@nara.gov>
Tel.: 202-741-5770
Fax: 202-741-5769

If you need further assistance or would like to discuss any aspect of your request, please do not hesitate to contact the Commission’s FOIA Public Liaison, Gail Adams, in any of the following ways:

Postal Regulatory Commission
FOIA Public Liaison
901 New York Avenue, NW, Suite 200
